alert.note: Alert for Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 4:11PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wake County through 445 PM EDT... At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Raleigh, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Cary, Garner, RDU International, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Knightdale, Lake Wheeler, Interstate 40 between RTP and Garner, the Beltline and William B Umstead State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
